name: Ash Gill
description:
Popular gorge walking site used by numerous centres across the whole of the North of England. Can get extremely (!) busy during the Summers. Recent (2016) damage to trails during Summer seasons may jeopardise future access.

Gorge itself is short and easy, but very scenic.

One 10m rappel to start (Ashgill Force). Anchor bolts are messy, and seem to have been placed without much of a plan. There are over 6 bolts - some must be around or over 15 years old now ('ownership' of these bolts is actually a source of contention between local outdoor providers).

After the rappel, follow the stream for 2 jumps and a short slide. Ash Gill then joins the South Tyne, which is a good high water kayak gorge run.
